data.title: Fearing AI job losses, some young workers in Britain shift towards skilled trades
data.description: In a labour market where artificial intelligence is quickly transforming and sometimes replacing jobs, student Maryna Yaroshenko wanted to find a future-proof career that offered long-term stability.  Like a growing number of young people in Britain and beyond, 18-year-old ​Yaroshenko opted for a skilled trade and is now training to become a plumber.  "That's something AI won't take over," said Yaroshenko, who is originally from Ukraine ‌and is studying at the City of Westminster College (CWC) in London.
data.keywords: skilled trades, Stephen Davis, skilled trade, Yaroshenko, City of Westminster College, Trades Union Congress, labour market, Bouke Klein Teeselink, plumbing
